unnormalised: RBI recently hiked the repo rate by 0.25%, and now banks are saying they'll "consider" increasing their loan interest rates. Consider! Like we have a choice? As if we're deciding between paneer butter masala and dal makhani for dinner! My EMI is already giving me heart palpitations, and now they want to add more pressure? My salary isn't increasing by 0.25%, that's for sure. Maybe I should just start paying them in Monopoly money. I hear that's appreciating faster than my investments anyway!

unnormalised: Last month, I was told that my home loan EMI was going to be ₹23,500/month. At that time, I was like, "Okay, cool. I can manage that, I suppose". Now, with the rates going up, I'm looking at something closer to ₹24,000+. Which is basically a chai ka kharcha, right? Just 500 more rupees! Only problem is, I drink like, 3 cups a day at ₹10 each! So, I guess I'll just cut back on chai then... Not a chance!

Now, with the rates going up, I am looking at something closer to rupee twenty four thousand plus. Which is basically a chai ka kharcha, right? Just five hundred more rupees! Only problem is, I drink like, three cups a day at rupee ten each! So, I guess I will just cut back on chai then... Not a chance!

unnormalised: And car loans? Don’t even get me started! My friend, Rakesh, took a loan for his "dream" Maruti Suzuki. He's now calculating how many hours he needs to work at his IT job (at ₹500/hour after tax) just to cover the increased interest! He’s joked about renting out the car as a mobile tea stall to offset the cost! Honestly, at this rate, that might be a viable business plan.

unnormalised: Experts are saying this will help curb inflation. Sure, maybe. But it’s also curbing my ability to eat anything other than Maggi for the next 6 months. I'm thinking of starting a support group for EMI sufferers. We can all cry together and share tips on how to survive on a budget of ₹100 per day. Meetings will be held every Tuesday at 7 PM, location: my terrace (because I can't afford to go anywhere else).
